before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"fb53b","text":"Ensure your cultures are at the correct growth phase for measurement. We developed the protocol with cells growing in exponential growth but depending on the requirements of the researcher this may not be applicable. guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"7mm9a","text":"This protocol has been developed using Thalassiosira spp. diatoms and may be applied to other taxa, however the staining concentration may need adjusting according to the permeability of cells to the dye. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":39,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ea51h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"faisp","text":"As the incubation is performed in the dark, the effects of differential light treatments on cultures may not be captured.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: Reactive oxygen species, phytoplankton, diatoms, ROS

{"blocks":[{"key":"9grpo","text":"Read the fluorescence of all wells (treatments and blanks) on a plate reader (e.g. Tecan Infinite® M1000 Pro) at excitation/emission  of 488nm excitation 525nm emission. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8pga6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3nsmb","text":" complete list of settings that we used for our experiments were as follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fook3","text":"Multiple reads per well 4x4 (circle, filled), border 1000 µm","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8pr11","text":"Excitation wavelength: 488 nm","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"h8q1","text":"Emission wavelength: 525 nm","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aajrc","text":"Excitation bandwith: 5 nm","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ededp","text":"Emission bandwith 5 nm","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8bp86","text":"Gain: 100","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ervh4","text":"Number of flashes: 50","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ds75t","text":"Flash frequency: 400 Hz","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"acnv9","text":"Integration time: 20 µs","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f4tus","text":"Lag time: 0 µs","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ei8pc","text":"Settle time: 10 ms","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ddl74","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8oht6","text":"Gain settings will depend on the specific plate reader being used and on the density of the culture. If the culture is very dense the fluorescence will read as \"OVER\" in which case reduce the gain settings and read again. However, it is very important to maintain the same gain setting across an experiment in order to cross-compare different cultures. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"equipment","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":2711,"brand":"Tecan","can_edit":0,"guid":"7A2EDD60053511ECB26581B3A105BBCC","link":"https://lifesciences.tecan.com/microplate-readers","name":"Infinite® M1000 Pro","sku":"n/a","specifications":"Note M1000 Pro no longer in production, newer models such as the Spark are available and will serve the same purpose.","type":"Microplate reader","vendor":{"id":453,"name":"Tecan","link":"https://www.tecan.com/","is_requested":false,"image":{"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"}},"file":null,"image":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aa3jd","text":"Calculate raw fluorescence (Relative fluorescence units RFU) for ROS with the following calculation:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3fa1j","text":"Fluorescence of stained well - Fluorescence of the blank well","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5468g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fmsq8","text":"Estimate the number of cells in each aliquot using flow cytometry (cite other protocol). Divide the value calculated in step 6 by the number of cells in the aliquot to obtain a ROS per cell measure (in RFU). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3chb3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jah5","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fcgnr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"29it9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2ftur","text":"If comparing between diatom taxa of different sizes, size correction may be applicable. In this instance forward scatter measures from the flow cytometer may be used as a proxy for cell size. A size correction can be done by dividing the ROS per cell measure from step 7 by the median forward scatter or the estimated cell size (when using size beads).","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"95aot","text":"Seal the plate with a Breathe-Easy sealing membrane to prevent evaporation during incubation. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dec95","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1pgv0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"chmun","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"equipment","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":2712,"brand":"Breathe-Easy®","can_edit":0,"guid":"4338A0F0055011ECA8C50F0B7F527546","link":"https://www.sigmaaldrich.com","name":"Breathe-Easy® sealing membrane","sku":"Z380059-1PAK","specifications":null,"type":"Plate seal","vendor":{"id":8,"name":"Merck Millipore (EMD Millipore)","link":"http://www.emdmillipore.com/","is_requested":false,"image":{"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"}},"file":null,"image":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cp4v9","text":"Gently shake plate by hand to ensure even mixing of the stain within the culture.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
